DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information relating to the time required to set up for RT delivery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Total time required for preparation of delivery of radiation therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act or process of making something ready; also a medication made ready for administration; also an anatomic or pathologic specimen made ready and preserved for study.

Concepts.definition: The act or process of making something ready.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ISO 8061 time recorded as hh:mm:ss based on a 24 hour clock.   Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/30/17 jk transferred context; added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 8/29/13 curated for the CFR Standardization work. tt

ReferenceDocuments.name: Time from initial set-up comp
ReferenceDocuments.description: Time from initial set-up complete until patient is ready to be treated
